file_content.text: I told you, agent. This Jedi never fails.
My team came to assist you. We discovered the outpost was destroyed and assumed the worst.
Can you tell us what happened? We have unconfirmed reports the Imperial spymaster Watcher One is on Taris.
You'll find the bodies of Watcher One and all his men at an Imperial base in the swamp.
He's dead.
Imperial base? I'll send a recovery team immediately.
He was here, but he left. He's no longer serving the Empire.
He's gone.
The head of SIS will be interested to hear that.
The spymaster was working for Darth Angral. I dealt with Watcher One--but the Empire knows too much about us.
This was Angral's doing.
The Empire's spy network will suffer without Watcher One's guidance. That buys us time.
This planet was crawling with Imperials and Sith. If not for me, it still would be.
You people are useless.
I'll recommend additional military forces be sent to secure Taris.
Doctor Godera--you're looking well, all things considered. Ready to come home?
Depends. Are you ready to do what's right?
I always was--and our time has finally come.
Agent, bring Doctor Godera to Coruscant immediately. I'll brief him on the discovery at Ord Mantell.
Agent, bring Doctor Godera to Coruscant immediately. We'll be needing his skills.
Contact me from your ship. Var Suthra out.
Then this is goodbye. You saved my life. I owe you.
I'd never have found you without your droid. The Imperials destroyed it, but I salvaged the memory core.
Not just me--your droid, too.
Ah--Remo. One of my favorites. Thank you for salvaging his parts.
Yes, I look forward to putting him back together.
Help us defeat the Empire, and we'll call it even.
Then rejoin the Republic.
Rest assured, I've invented plenty of new ways to eradicate that plague.
It was my honor to help. You owe me nothing.
Jedi don't keep score.
Advanced technology is always useful. I hear you're the man to see about that.
Yes, you do.
When I'm settled in on Coruscant, I'll send you a proper token of thanks.
This droid of yours helped track you down. Can you fix him?
Doctor Godera droid RE-M0 = needs repair // T7 + Jedi = saved memory core
Before I go... those droid parts you're carrying--they belong to one of mine?
Let's see... ah, Remo. A bit worse for wear, but I think I can repair him.
That droid's a hero. He deserves a second chance.
He's all yours.
This time, give him a body that isn't so fragile.
Make him sturdier.
Excellent suggestion. He'd make a fine security droid.
He's also extremely annoying. Maybe you can fix that, too.
Change his personality.
Not without a memory wipe. I'd never do that to such a faithful droid.
Working on Remo will make the long flight to Coruscant more bearable.
Goodbye for now. I'm sure we'll see each other again.
You'll have to excuse me. I'm on official Republic business.
General, the Jedi just walked in with Doctor Godera. They're alive, sir!
